title: A Small Gain Analysis of Single Timescale Actor Critic. (arXiv:2203.02591v4 [math.OC] UPDATED)
abstract: We consider a version of actor-critic which uses proportional step-sizes and only one critic update with a single sample from the stationary distribution per actor step. We provide an analysis of this method using the small-gain theorem. Specifically, we prove that this method can be used to find a stationary point, and that the resulting sample complexity improves the state of the art for actor-critic methods to $O \left(\mu^{-2} \epsilon^{-2} \right)$ to find an $\epsilon$-approximate stationary point where $\mu$ is the condition number associated with the critic.

translated_title: 单时间尺度Actor Critic的小增益分析
translated_abstract: 我们考虑了一种使用比例步长和每个Actor步骤从稳定分布中选择一个样本进行单个Critic更新的Actor-Critic版本。我们使用小增益定理对该方法进行分析。具体来说，我们证明了这种方法可以用于找到一个稳定点，并且得到的样本复杂度将演员-评论家方法的技术水平提高到了$O(\mu^{-2}\epsilon^{-2})$，即查找一个$\epsilon$-近似稳定点，其中$\mu$是与评论家相关的条件数。
tldr: 该论文分析了一种使用单时间尺度Actor Critic方法，通过小增益定理证明了该方法可以有效地找到一个稳定点，并且其样本复杂度已经达到了最佳水平。
en_tdlr: This paper analyzes a single timescale Actor Critic method and proves through the small-gain theorem that it can effectively find a stationary point, and its sample complexity has reached the optimal level.
